attributes.action: Mandatory in depth training and understanding of SEN  for all teaching staff
attributes.background: Teaching staff are under trained in special educational needs and have a lack of understanding for these children. This impacts not only these children but other children in the school. This downfall in education will follow these children in adulthood in forms of depression. This needs to change
attributes.additional_details: After speaking with parents who have childen with special educational needs in mainstream schools, we all agree our main concern is a lack of in depth training/understanding teachers have in our childrens conditions. This has a negative impact on not only our children but family life and others. We feel we aren't listened to in schools. our children are treated as less important within the school. Some get very little help or like my son who is autistic dyspraxic and dyslexic gets no help at all

attributes.action: Introduce a Brain Aneurysm Awareness month to help save lives.
attributes.background: Approximately 1 in 50 people unknowingly have a brain aneurysm as most are only discovered if they rupture. This leads to an extremely dangerous condition known as a subarachnoid haemorrhage which can cause extensive brain damage. Help us raise awareness by signing. Know the facts, save a life!
attributes.additional_details:
NHS Facts
Approx 3 out of 5 people who suffer from a SAH die within 2 weeks. Half of those who survive are usually left with brain damage or disability.

http://www.nhs.uk/Conditions/Aneurysm/Pages/Introduction.aspx

attributes.action: For the court to issue a consecutive sentence and not concurrent.
attributes.background: If a civil servant is assaulted doing their duties and if the person is convicted in court they should get a consecutive sentence to any other convictions and not a concurrent sentence. If that person is serving a life sentence, when granted parole it is then added past their parole date.
attributes.additional_details: Having been assaulted myself where the perpetrator was given a concurrent sentence, where this left me feeling let down by the justice system. More recently a colleague was hit 4 times with a metal pole over his back while dealing with another incident and the perpetrator was given a 4 month concurrent sentence. This is during the zero tolerance to violence which the civil service champions, but when the prisoner is given a concurrent sentence it doesn't send the message of zero tolerance.

attributes.action: NHS to lower smear test age to 18
attributes.background: I believe that the NHS should lower the smear test age to 18: After so many scary stories of young women suffering from cervical cancer. Women are being refused smear test due to being younger than 25.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/cervical-cancer-victim-dies-aged-9607214.amp?client=safari 

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-2767864/My-daughter-died-cervical-cancer-visiting-doctors-NINE-times-Mother-s-campaign-lower-smear-test-age-22-year-old-told-young-screening.html

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2588651/Mother-tragic-model-19-died-cervical-cancer-tells-heartache-doctors-refusal-daughter-smear-test.html

attributes.action: Make Strangles a Notifiable Disease
attributes.background: Strangles is a deadly and horrific disease in horses. Bacteria is spread through direct and indirect contact. It causes horses great distress and pain and is difficult to deal with. Outbreaks are currently managed by the common sense of horse owners but often still result in spread of the disease.
attributes.additional_details: It often happens that outbreaks are kept secret and advised biosecurity is not adhered to correctly. Horse Welfare is the biggest concern as containment procedures are optional, meaning that it often spreads and more horses suffer. The damage to the equine industry is great; entire show seasons lost, loss of livestock, and loss of income. Were it a notifiable disease anyone who had a case would not be able to keep it secret and they would have to put correct biosecurity measures in place by law.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for Landlord to discriminate against people on Housing Benefits
attributes.background: Most private landlords, letting agancies and even mortgage companies stipulate in their terms and conditions, that the house can not be rented to anyone on benefits.  With very low stock of social housing this has created a housing crisis for poorer people and families.
attributes.additional_details: This is discrimination against a group of people,  based on an assumption of negative traits and should be declared illegal.

attributes.action: Give legal rights to Aunties and Uncles
attributes.background: Recently my niece was taken into care but there was nothing I could do to stop that from happening because I'm just an auntie. I tried to contact the Solicitors for legal aid, but because I was just an auntie, I was told I have no rights to appeal or apply for custody. I want this changed.

attributes.action: Provide mental health support for all parents of premature and sick babies in UK
attributes.background:
90,253 premature and sick babies were admitted to a neonatal unit in the UK. [Neonatal Data Analysis Unit, 2014 report]
Parents of these babies are 10 times more likely to suffer post-natal depression.
41% of neonatal units have no access to trained support; 30% no support at all.
attributes.additional_details:
Little Miracles UK are campaigning to see: 

(1) Funding/resources for mental health support for all neonatal units in the UK 
(2) Mental health screening for all parents of premature and sick babies. 
(3) A trained mental health worker e.g. a counsellor, assigned to all neonatal units 
(4) After leaving hospital; care and professional support for as long as it is needed 
(5) Provision for peer-to-peer support, or similar, for these parents

attributes.action: Exempt Charities from paying Insurance Premium Tax (IPT)
attributes.background: We believe the Government should be doing everything it can to support the vital work charities are doing, not imposing unnecessary costs on them. We call for charities to be exempted from Insurance Premium Tax (IPT).
attributes.additional_details: The Government could introduce an exemption from, or reduction in, IPT for all UK Charities. A further rise in the rate of standard UK IPT was announced recently. From 1st June 2017 IPT charged on charities' insurance premiums will increase to 12%. This represents a 100% increase in an 18 month period. These increases have and will continue to negatively affect charities who have already suffered in the last few years from reduced income while seeing an increase in the demand for their services.

attributes.action: FREE Junior use of council sports fields/ pitches and a cap on the Adult price.
attributes.background:
I want the Government to make local sports fields/pitches owned by any local councils FREE for use by junior sports teams (Under 18) and a Cap on the cost for Adult sports teams.

Councils are looking to earn money Instead of keeping our society fit and healthy!

SAVE OUR CHILDREN'S HEALTH!
attributes.additional_details:
Leeds City Council Charges...

2012/13 season...
Adults: £521 per team, per pitch
Junior: £191 per team, per pitch

2016/17 season
current charges..
Adults: £556 per team, per pitch
Junior: £215 per team, per pitch

The prices charged for pitches in Leeds goes up most years', meaning less and less Children can get involved with their local sports club as the price becomes a barrier for some families, especially those on low incomes or benefits.

attributes.action: Accept more visas from Pakistan
attributes.background: People applying for Visa from Pakistan are being unfairly treated.  Figures obtained from UK Immigration & Visa office state that visa acceptance from Pakistan in 2015 was 46.9% & from India it was 89.2%.In 2016 up to September 30th the figure was 46.1% from Pakistan & 87% from India, highly unjust.

attributes.action: For it to be standard, regular, practice to measure babies' heads.
attributes.background: Poppy's story! On August 25th Poppy's parents received the devastating news that she had water on the brain along with tumours. If Poppy's head had been measured they would have known it was the size of a 2 year old, having JUST turned one!
attributes.additional_details: Poppy's head was 6cm too big and had never been measured/recorded in her red book. Poppy is currently, with her parents, in HDU in Manchester Children's Hospital awaiting her fourth brain operation!

attributes.action: Introduce mandatory self-defence classes into UK secondary schools
attributes.background: I propose that the UK Government introduces mandatory self-defence classes, or a self-defence programme, into the Physical Education (P.E.) part of the curriculum in secondary schools to equip children with the skills they need to defend themselves against an attacker.
attributes.additional_details: Children of today are regularly facing the threat of assault in a range of scenarios from bullying within schools to street abductions. I feel it is incredibly important to start equipping children with key self-defence skills in order to defend themselves against an attack effectively – without putting themselves in further danger. UK self-defence law should be taught as part of any self-defence classes or programmes introduced into schools; to prevent self-defence being used inappropriately.

attributes.action: Amnesty from prosecution and questioning of British Forces Veterans
attributes.background: The questioning and subsequent charging of ex service personnel, needs to stop. These serviceman and women served their country in good faith under orders and within the 'rules of engagement'. We, ex and current service personnel won't stand by and watch good men and women hanged out to dry.

attributes.action: Stop The Human Rights Abuse: Suspend Diplomatic Relations with Cameroon
attributes.background:
Within the past few weeks, Cameroon police have been beating up protesters including Common Law Lawyers. Some civilians have died and many injured. 
Social media is awash with images of lawyers assaulted by security forces, their wigs and gowns confiscated

Stop this from becoming a genocide!
attributes.additional_details:
The protests,  began with Lawyers, teachers and spread to student bodies, are all against the systematic marginalisation of English-speaking Cameroonians. 
See http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-38078238 

See http://bareta.press/federalism-political-issue-pm-tells-lawyers/ 

THEIR DEMAND IS FOR A TWO-STATE FEDERATION WITH EQUAL AUTONOMY 

Please ask the UK to suspend diplomatic relations with Cameroon until it stops its crackdown on peaceful protesters and start listening to their demands

attributes.action: petition the government to stop or at least suspend foreign aid
attributes.background: we have so many issues within the UK that we ned to re-examine whether we can afford foreign aid.
attributes.additional_details: We are struggling to maintain front line services, have people living from food banks in poverty and homelessness is on the rise. On the other hand we are spending a huge amount of money on foreign aid, giving it to countries who can afford to run a space program for example? We see on a daily basis that this money is abused - i believe this money would be better spent on issues within the UK supporting our own people.

attributes.action: Guarantee rights of all EU citizens in UK as condition of Art 50 notice
attributes.background:
If the UK claims to open to the world, it needs to lead by example. 

It is the right thing to do morally and will create goodwill with the EU/other Member States. As a by product, it means they will come under pressure to reciprocate for UK citizens in the EU.

attributes.action: Make driving a car using a mobile phone a disqualification offence
attributes.background: So many people killed and injured by car drivers using there phone and killing people and the offence gets 3 point on your licence. It's as dangerous as drink driving
attributes.additional_details: Every week in a newspaper you can read of a person getting killed or injured by someone using a mobile whilst driving

attributes.action: Put Anglo Saxon history,  on the national curriculum for secondary schools.
attributes.background: To many people the history of our country starts with William the Conqueror.  But there is a long and colourful history before this. A history that includes the formation of our country, the laying down of laws that are still in use today and the only English king ti be given the moniker "The Great"

attributes.action: Abolish the exemptions that MPs have received from the Investigatory Powers Act.
attributes.background: The Investigatory Powers Act 2016 has just been passed by Parliament. It introduces further surveillance powers for UK spies. Most of the stronger powers require a warrant which can be usually issued by a secretary of state. For MPs, however, the Prime Minister must approve the warrant.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2016/25/contents/enacted

http://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/gadgets-and-tech/news/investigatory-powers-bill-a7447781.html

attributes.action: Teens and young adults with Type 1 Diabetes have a right to PIP.
attributes.background: Type 1 diabetes is a life long, life threatening condition. Current government legislation does consider it to be a disability for children aged 16 and above.  PIP would give them the financial help they need to fund the additional things they need to become independent.
attributes.additional_details: It is a proven fact that without the help and support of parents/health professionals and peers.  Adolescents would struggle to cope with the day to day care of dealing with the challenges of Type 1 diabetes.  They are more likely to be hospitalised and suffer damage to their bodies that come with poor management.  The policies of this current government, denies them the support they need during these difficult years. PIP awards would help these young people cope with the financial strain of daily living, and give recognition that Type 1 diabetes is a disability.

attributes.action: Condemn UNESCO and suspend any Government funding
attributes.background: On 13th October 2016, UNESCO, passed a draft resolution denying Jewish connections with The Temple Mount. This resolution is inherently Anti-Semitic  We call on the Government to condemn the resolution and suspend payments to UNESCO until its charter revokes any further racist abuse.
attributes.additional_details:
Jerusalem is mentioned 806 times in the Old Testament. The Temple Mount was the the site to which Abraham  took Isaac was the home to five Jewish Temples, and has been the focal point of Jewish prayers since. 
The Palestinians have a long history of abusing UN bodies in an attempt to deligitimise Jewish claims to The Holy Land. 
This latest resolution at UNESCO is not only Anti-Semitic in challenging the fundamental belief of Jews but also challenges the fundamental basis of  Christianity

attributes.action: Award of a National Defence Medal
attributes.background: I propose an award of a National Defence Medal to all serving and ex- serving members of HM Forces in recognition of the service that they have given/give to their country and to the people, subject to meeting certain criteria.
attributes.additional_details:
Not everyone was able to go into a war like zone but they nevertheless gave 100% effort.

Please recognise their efforts.

http://nationaldefencemedal.webs.com/Submission%20for%20the%20UK%20National%20Defence%20Medal.pdf

attributes.action: Grant 1 year post-study internship stay for international students.
attributes.background: Capacity of international students to develop their countries is limited due to lack of internship opportunities. Increasing post-study stay to 1 year which was reduced from 2 years to 4months in 2012, will benefit developing countries as international graduates can return with better experience.
attributes.additional_details:
International students contribute up to £14.2 billion to UK economy in 2015 (NUS, 2016) with majority coming from resource poor countries (www.hefce.com). 
In the face of ongoing global challenges,  developing future generations of leaders is crucial. 
This can be achieved by allowing international students in UK a stay up to 1 year post-study to seek internship placement and gained practical knowledge. Evidence has shown that on-the-job training provides better learning outcomes (Ellstrom,2014)

attributes.action: Revoke bedside charges for patients in NHS.
attributes.background:
For 69 years the NHS has been a shining example to the world of high quality universal and comprehensive healthcare, free at the point of use. 
The introduction of charges to non-EEA citizens will eliminate the NHS as we know it.
Doctors' priority is to treat patients, not to act as border guards.
attributes.additional_details:
Our NHS is in grave danger, not because of health tourists, but because of a market system, private sector inefficiency and crippling PFI debts. Checking the identity of patients to recoup <0.5% of the budget from health tourists will be expensive and costly with minimal benefit. It will also encourage inequality of provision, poorer clinical outcomes, racial profiling and will undermine the professional duties healthcare professionals must abide by. 
Doctors and nurses demand this is revoked.

attributes.action: Repeal The Hunting Act
attributes.background: The hunting act is a poorly constructed and worded piece of legislation, time for repeal
attributes.additional_details: The hunting act is a poorly constructed and worded piece of legislation. Having been in place for over ten years now it has not saved a single fox; hare or deer, only subjected them to less humane methods of control. It is now time to revisit this subject and repeal this ill thought out piece of legislation

attributes.action: To review the sentencing guidelines for offences of deliberate animal cruelty
attributes.background: The existing penalties for animal cruelty are far too lenient and do not act as a deterrent. The sentencing guidelines for offences under the Animal Health Act need reviewing to introduce much tougher sentences for deliberately & wilfully causing suffering and death to animals, eg minimum sentences
attributes.additional_details: Our existing animal welfare legislation is rooted in times when animals were seen as possessions, chattels, or tools of a trade. The current maximum sentences available do nothing to deter the people who indulge in deliberate cruelty for "fun", or who take part in dog fighting or other illegal activities. The introduction of a minimum custodial sentence on conviction of say, three or four years, with no remission or parole, would act as more of a threat to these people and make them think twice.

attributes.action: Take action so that 237,000 eligible carers get state pension 'Carer's Credits'
attributes.background: The government must do more ensure approximately 237,000 carers receive National Insurance (NI) credits to their state pension. It's estimated that as many as 95% of the 250,000 carers who could get Carer's Credits are not receiving them. They may retire on a lower state pension as a result.
attributes.additional_details:
Figures from 2015 showed only 5% of eligible carers were receiving Carer's Credits: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/pensions-minister-too-many-carers-missing-out-on-ni-credits

The estimate of only 5% of the estimated 250,000 eligible carers claiming Carer's Credit was provided by DWP from the Family Resources Survey 2014-15, published in June 2016. https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/531242/family-resources-survey-2014-15.pdf

attributes.action: Make Organ Donation compulsory in the U.K. unless an individual opts out.
attributes.background:
As of 2010, 24 European countries have some form of presumed consent (opt-out) system, with the most prominent and limited opt-out systems in Spain, Austria, and Belgium yielding high donor rates.

In the United Kingdom organ donation is voluntary and no consent is presumed.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently there are over 7,000 people on the UK national transplant waiting list and, during the last financial year, over 1,300 people either died whilst on the waiting list or became too sick to receive a transplant. This is because, despite more than 500,000 people dying each year in the UK, fewer than 5,000 people die in circumstances where they can become a donor. 

If we can increase the amount of people by only 5% this will save lives each and every week in the UK.

attributes.action: Make it those with cystic fibrosis automatically transfer from DLA to pip
attributes.background: People suffering from conditions like cystic fibrosis that have qualified for DLA must currently apply for pip at 16 . This is a lifelong degenerative multi system condition requiring daily medications and physiotherapy
attributes.additional_details: Currently in the UK half of cystic fibrosis sufferers live to be over 40 . Daily medication and physiotherapy is required to help reduce mucus build up and antibiotics to prevent infections that will cause scar tissue damage to lungs . Adults with cystic fibrosis must pay for their prescription medication if they work even though not taking it would eventually result in death

attributes.action: Teach sign language (makaton) to primary school children & teachers
attributes.background: I am mum to a child who cannot speak, we use makaton to communicate. My child was discriminated against at her primary school, who refused to teach makaton. Teaching Makaton would mean children/adults would be able to communicate throughout their life making society more inclusive & less frustrating
attributes.additional_details: My daughter signs to communicate. When we go out and she tries to communicate, everyone always asks me 'what is she saying'. Knowing just yes & no in sign & to understand children/adults with disabilities would make such a difference. Without better communication many people are trapped in their world. If we are accepting of people with disabilities why are we not teaching all children sign language to enable communication for all https://www.makaton.org/aboutMakaton/

attributes.action: Change the law so the councils must scan all dead pets for a microchip.
attributes.background:
Most people assume their cat would be scanned if found dead and collected by the council, and that they would be informed, but this is simply not the case. 

When a cat gets killed in a traffic accident, the councils have no legal obligation to scan for a microchip. This need to change.
attributes.additional_details:
The scanners are relatively cheap (£40) and all councils have them already to scan the stray dogs, since they are obliged to do that.

The change in law will be easy and inexpensive to implement. 
It will also save a lot of pet owners from the pain of not knowing what happened to their beloved pets.

attributes.action: Child maintenance payments to be worked out from NET pay not GROSS pay.
attributes.background: Child maintenance should be work out for the paying parent from there NET pay NOT from there GROSS pay as the working parent does not even see nor take home in the bank the GROSS pay so they are getting penalized twice from the tax man and Child maintenance
attributes.additional_details:
Example: - Parent on £36,000 per year GROSS pay. 
Actual take home pay £24,000 per year NET pay. 
Child maintenance work out your weekly pay from £36,000 this would be £692.00 per week in pay. When actually your weekly take home pay is £461.00 
Action needs to be taken so that child maintenance is worked out from your NET pay not your GROSS pay as parents just cannot afford to live taking money from parents that do not even see this in the bank accounts. 

Please sign and make this happen for the paying parent. Everyone should pay for there child but it has to be fair.

attributes.action: Scrap land factor maintenance arrangements by companies on housing estates.
attributes.background: New estates are burdened with extra maintenance charges from private companies. The industry is unregulated, uncontrolled and monopolised in such a manner that unfairly disadvantages residents
attributes.additional_details:
There are hundreds of new build estates across the UK that are burdened with extra charges to resident for the maintenance of the open shared spaces on their estates. The residents have no choice in which company carries out the work. The charges are over inflated, the quality of work is substandard and companies bully residents into continued payments with threats of legal action. 
There seems to be no clear way of complaint, and no independent way of arbitration or enforcement of standards.

attributes.action: Government to introduce different regulations around indemnity insurance for IM
attributes.background: Due to the current governing body for midwifery (The NMC)stating that current independent midwifery practice indemnity insurance is not sufficient we are asking for the government to introduce different regulations that will provide adequate indemnity insurance for independent midwives.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for the C of E to discriminate against gay non-celibate clergy
attributes.background: The Anglican Church insists that gay clergy with partners live a celibate life if they wish to continue working as priests or bishops. This is an unfair burden on gay clergy as well as being discriminatory within the 21st century workplace.

attributes.action: Hold a 2nd referendum which includes 2 million EU Nationals living in Britain.
attributes.background:
Did the EU referendum breach the
CHARTER OF FUNDAMENTAL RIGHTS OF THE EU
CH V: CITIZENS' RIGHTS Article 41
Right to good administration
2.     This right includes:
the right of every person to be heard, before any individual measure which would affect him or her adversely is taken;
attributes.additional_details:
The EU Referendum precluded over 2 million EU Nationals living in Britain from voting, the outcome of which will affect them adversely.
If we leave the EU it is likely EU Nationals will stay in Britain and will then have the right to vote in all elections, with a possibility of a coalition government with the SNP and Liberal Democrats calling for a referendum.
The vote to leave the EU has sent shock waves throughout Europe we have a chance to influence the EU and re-unite Europe.

attributes.action: President Trump should be invited to address Parliament during visit
attributes.background: President Donald Trump should be welcomed to the UK in his capacity as head of the US Government and honour Her Majesty with a State visit and address the houses of Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: The UK and US enjoy a special relationship like no other two countries. While former president Obama wanted to send us to the back of the queue, President Trump promised to bring us to the front and partner with the UK on trade and security. President Trump showed the UK his respect by inviting PM May as the first foreign leader to visit him. Regardless of the opinion some hold of him, as the President of the US he deserves the respect he showed the UK.

attributes.action: Remove Cannabis And Hemp From The 1971 Misuse Of Drugs Act
attributes.background: The law states cannabis has no medicinal value, science has shown cannabis has a vast medicinal profile and can help with a plethora of health problems humans have an endocannabinoid system with autoregulatory homeostatic mechanisms cannabinoids ARE FUNDAMENTAL for protection and maintenance
attributes.additional_details:
There is no scientific justification for the current scheduling of cannabis and hemp in the 1971 drugs act, the law violates the right to the highest attainable standard of health.The goverment must repeal the law to allow people to OBTAIN this FUNDAMENTAL SUPPLIMENT / FORTHWITH 
cannabis is available in 29 states of America,Spain,Holland,Canada,Portugal, https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legality_of_cannabis_by_country

attributes.action: Allow Parliament a vote on planned Hinkley Point C/Bradwell nuclear power plants
attributes.background: The decision to accept the investment  from EDF and China to design, build and operate the first new ( as yet untested) nuclear power stations in a generation must be made only with the consent of parliament.
attributes.additional_details: Just a retired engineer who I believe represents the mass of public opinion

attributes.action: Hold a public inquiry into the institutional bullying of carers by officialdom.
attributes.background: The institutional bullying of family carers (and those they care for) by various official bodies is now a nationally recognised phenomenon. It is known as 'mother blame' (men are also targeted). A public inquiry into this phenomenon is imperative - to address the issues and halt the practice.
attributes.additional_details:
The institutional bullying of carers (and those they care for) is a regular occurrence within local authorities, the NHS and care companies.

If carers stand up for the person they care for, or make a complaint, they are targeted; facing bullying, harassment and intimidation from those who are supposed to help and support them. Tactics employed against carers include the abuse of the MCA, MHA and safeguarding, deliberately incorrect assessments of capacity/need, general harassment and threats.

attributes.action: Please offer Justin Trudeau, the Prime Minister of Canada, a State visit.
attributes.background: Justin Trudeau is the Prime Minister of Canada — he would be very welcome here.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum in Scotland to give the country a choice to repeal devolution.
attributes.background:
The Scottish government are failing Scotland by focusing on their pursuit for Scottish Independence over governing the country. 

Give Scotland a chance to dissolve Holyrood and repeal devolution, trusting democratically elected Scotland MP's to represent Scotland in Parliament.

attributes.action: The law on WPA (widowed parents allowance) needs to be updated.
attributes.background: Currently those with children who are not married are not entitled to financial help with bereavement payments.
attributes.additional_details:
The discrimination of children from cohabiting couples rather than married ones is inconsistent with our human rights policy.
Please sign this petition to force the government to bring this benefit to all vulnerable families not only those with married parents.

attributes.action: Keep trains running between Watton-at-Stone and Stevenage after 2018.
attributes.background: Hertfordshire County Council calls on the Government to take action to accelerate the infrastructure works at Stevenage station, to enable Govia Thameslink Railway (GTR) to run trains between Watton-at-Stone and Stevenage after 2018.
attributes.additional_details:
GTR has proposed changes to its new timetable, which include a replacement shuttle bus service between Watton-at-Stone and Stevenage from 2018. This has been blamed on delays to the construction of a fifth platform at Stevenage, which has been pushed back by Network Rail into its work programme for 2019-24.

The council calls on the Department for Transport to work with Network Rail to bring forward the implementation of the fifth platform and keep this important rail link in operation.

attributes.action: Raise the issue of the Taiji Dolphin slaughters with the Japanese Government
attributes.background: I've been horrified to learn & witness that every year in Taiji,Japan, dolphins are chased into a small cover and butchered in the most horrific and cruel way imaginable. The hunts are subsidized by the dolphin captivity industry,for a few "show quality' dolphins that are ripped from their families.
attributes.additional_details: People across the world have been shocked by this act of cruelty that is live streamed by many welfare organisation to raise awareness, e.g. dolphin project, sea shepherd,racing against extinction etc. This year the order book for Taiji is 150 dolphins for captivity, anymore captured will be killed. The world is watching and speaking out against Taiji but Governments continue to ignore their people. We ask, when will someone in power step forward and end this horrific act before its too late.

attributes.action: Stop outsourcing our NHS services to outside Companies
attributes.background: I feel it is totally wrong to outsource our NHS services to private Companies, such as Richard Branson's & feel that the government is slowly beginning to privatize our National Health Service. This must not happen!

attributes.action: Repeal of the Vagrancy Act of 1824.
attributes.background: This act declares it a criminal act to sleep on the streets or to beg, hence making homelessness a crime.
attributes.additional_details:
The number of cases brought to court under the 1824 Vagrancy Act has surged by 70%, prompting concerns that cuts to support services and benefits are pushing more people to resort to begging. (2009)

https://www.theguardian.com/society/2014/nov/30/begging-prosecutions-increase-england-wales

attributes.action: Improve policies,procedures and legal requirements associated with Gas Safety
attributes.background: Although engineers must be Gas Safe registered to work on boilers and other gas appliances, the policies, procedures and legal requirements around this are so vague that people without the necessary skill and knowledge are putting peoples homes and lives at danger.
attributes.additional_details:
To ensure that only gas safe engineers are able to complete gas related works, we would like to make the following legal requirements.
- Retailers are able to sell Gas related products, parts and materials to registered engineers who show their card at the time of purchase.
- Gas Safe Engineers are required to present their card before entering a customers home when completing any gas work
- No commercial contracts made that relate to gas work without the inclusion of a gas safety registration number and copy of a gas card

attributes.action: Review unfair proposals to allocation of funding of selective schools in Torbay.
attributes.background:
The proposed National Funding Formula for Schools will be a drop of around 3% to the 3 selective schools in Torbay. 

The proposals, if implemented, will seriously endanger the ability of the school to maintain the outstanding education provided to the students and the results they achieve.
